page.title: 01SURVEY AREA, NORTH SOUTHWELL
page.content: Our survey area is the north of the main residential area of{Southwell, including the farming area beyond it and the village of{Hockerton.} This area of Southwell includes two streets with shops and some scattered corner shops. There is only a public house in Hockerton, no shops. The residential area of Southwell consists mainly of housing built between 195O and 197O, but some buildings in the middle of the town date from around 17OO. There are many fruit{farms}here. Southwell was where the famous{Bramley apple}was first grown. The area beyond is mainly farming land, given to the production of wheat and oilseed rape. The population of Southwell is about 6,OOO but is growing. Most of the working population travel to work in the surrounding towns.
